javadoc: The FunctionSignatureFieldLocation class provides specific information about the Function Signature field within a program location.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: locationAddr
params.comment: the address of the listing location (i.e., referent code unit)

params.name: charOffset
params.comment: the character position within the function signature string for this location.

params.name: signature
params.comment: the function signature String at this location.

params.comment: the character position within the function signature string for this location.

params.comment: the function signature String at this location.

name: FunctionSignatureFieldLocation
comment:
The FunctionSignatureFieldLocation class provides specific information
 about the Function Signature field within a program location.

fields.javadoc:
When true the <tt>charOffset</tt> is not used to represent character position, but 
 rather the character position is based upon the location of the subfield within the 
 signature.  For example, the start of the function name location may be the the character
 position when this flag is <tt>true</tt>.
fields.name: isFieldBasedPoisitioning
fields.comment:
When true the charOffset is not used to represent character position, but 
 rather the character position is based upon the location of the subfield within the 
 signature.  For example, the start of the function name location may be the the character
 position when this flag is true.
